intro: Cryptantha macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Cryptantha macrocalyx is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
